meanings.definition: Form a concept or idea of something.
meanings.sent1: I tried to conceptualise the story by imagining all the characters and settings in my mind.
meanings.sent2: Artists often conceptualise their paintings before putting brush to canvas.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the children try to conceptualise the concept of time by using a sundial made of playdough.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a canvas, ready to conceptualise the vibrant colors of her dreams.
meanings.sent5: In order to remember the steps, I always conceptualise the dance routine as a series of simple movements.

meanings.definition: To understand or interpret something in a conceptual way.
meanings.sent1: I find it easier to conceptualise complex ideas when I break them down into smaller parts.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often conceptualise data to make it easier to analyze and draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the cat try to conceptualise the idea of a laser pointer moving around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like puzzle pieces, waiting to be conceptualised into a coherent story.
meanings.sent5: To make the concept stick in my mind, I always conceptualise it as a colorful picture.
